text: Zak Andrew Rudden (born 6 February 2000) is a Scottish professional footballer who plays as a striker for Partick Thistle. ==Club career== Rudden began his career with Rangers and joined the first-team for pre-season before the start of the 2018-19 season for the first time. In August 2018, Rudden moved out on loan to Falkirk. On 15 September 2018, Rudden scored on his Bairns debut. On 23 August 2019 Rudden moved on loan to EFL League Two side Plymouth Argyle. He made his debut for the Pilgrims the next day, as a first half substitute in a 3–0 win over Walsall. He scored his first goal for the club in an EFL Trophy tie against Swindon Town on 8 October 2019. The loan ended in January 2020. On 15 January 2020 Rudden signed for Partick Thistle on a two and a half year deal. ==International career== Rudden has represented Scotland at youth international level. ==References== Category:2000 births Category:Living people Category:Scottish footballers Category:Scotland youth international footballers Category:Association football forwards Category:Rangers F.C. players Category:Falkirk F.C. players Category:Plymouth Argyle F.C. players Category:Scottish Professional Football League players Category:English Football League players Category:Partick Thistle F.C. players
title: Zak Rudden
